wms_article_body.body: Kolmar Korea Co., a leading cosmetic manufacturer, saw its second-quarter operating profit surge by more than 2 percent from a year ago. According to its regulatory filing on Friday, Kolmar Korea posted an operating profit of 73.5 billion won ($53.1 million) for the second quarter, up 2.42 percent from the same period a year ago. The figure, however, falls 11.6 percent short of the market consensus of 83.1 billion won compiled by Yonhap Infomax. Revenue increased 10.69 percent year-on-year to 730.8 billion won, while net profit declined 7.44 percent to 41.8 billion won.
